What we offer!

Know More

Fully Responsive

Our themes are 100% responsive, each and every element will fit every site – big or small with supporting modern browsers.

Dedicated Support

24/7 hours available in a day, so quick support can be provided to our customers on any confusion or issues.

Unlimited Color Options

We included a backend color picker for unlimited color options. Anything can be changed, including images!

Web Development

item.title: Why Choose Us?
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded: Business Click is a modern and flexible WordPress Business Theme that suits for agency, business, corporate, eCommerce, magazines, blog, portfolios and many more. It’s created by using the latest Bootstrap Framework with HTML5 and CSS3 techniques in accordance with the latest WordPress Coding Standards. Suitable all popular mobile devices and tablets. In order to create a professional website, you can easily customize the sections like Theme Customizer, Custom Container width options, Sticky Primary Menu – Hide Menu on Scroll Down, Top header bar, Featured Slider, Services, About us, Testimonial, Call to Action, News & Updates, Portfolio, Team, Multiple Footer Widgets, drag and drop widgets, Social Links, Custom Headers, Navigation, Contact us, Subscribe section, Font options, and many more. This creative theme supports popular plugins like Jetpack, WP page navi, Contact form 7, Elementor page builder, W3 Total Cache, Social Pug, All in One SEO Pack etc.

item.title: FAQs
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
What is WordPress? WordPress is a free and open-source content management system (CMS). You can use it to create beautiful websites, blogs, apps, etc. Is WordPress limited to just blogging? It is a common misconception that WordPress is meant just for blogging. However, it is completely false. WordPress can be used for creating corporate websites, e-commerce websites, web applications, education institution websites, blogs, forums, etc. How do I install a theme?

There are two ways to install a new theme: from your WordPress Admin Panel or manually via FTP.
Using Admin Panel

  1. Download the theme.
  2. Log in to your WordPress Administration Panels.
  3. Select the Appearance panel, then Themes.
  4. Click on Add New.
  5. Then select Upload Theme.
  6. Click Choose File and then locate the theme in your computer.
  7. Select the theme and click Install Now.

Using FTP Client

  1. Unzip the theme to your Desktop.
  2. Using an FTP client to access your host web server, go to /wp-content/themes/ and upload your new copy of the theme.
  3. Now, log into the WordPress Admin Dashboard.
  4. Select the Appearance panel, then Themes.
  5. You will see the theme in the list.
  6. Then click Activate button.
Do I need to buy themes to create my website? No. Although, there are premium themes (https://evisionthemes.com/product/tag/premium/ ) that you can buy, we offer free themes (https://evisionthemes.com/product/tag/free/ ) as well. The two major differences between them is that the premium themes offer more features than the free theme and the premium themes come with dedicated support which is not available for the free themes. Do I start from scratch if I upgrade to PRO? When you upgrade to the premium version of a product, everything integrates smoothly with your free version. The PRO version will just add the extra features and your existing content won’t be lost. What types of themes do you offer? We offer themes for different niche: business, web store, blogging, news sites, magazine sites, corporation, traveling, photography, restaurant, Hotels, Charity etc. The themes are available in free as well as the paid version.

Preformatted Block

The Road Not Taken, by Robert Frost

Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both
And be one traveler, long I stood 
And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair,
And having perhaps the better claim,
Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
Though as for that the passing there
Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay
In leaves no step had trodden black.
Oh, I kept the first for another day!
Yet knowing how way leads on to way,
I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh
Somewhere ages and ages hence:
Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—
I took the one less traveled by,
And that has made all the difference.
